results.title: Crash Zone: Identity Crisis
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Testing Alex’s new game, ‘Trillin’, the kids encounter Virgil, who is having an identity crisis. The surprised Alex is worried that Virgil might be a spy for rival company Sunijim. An offended Virgil gets the kids to help him prove he’s not a spy - but Virgil can’t remember who he really is! The kids discover Virgil has actually grown from a program created by Alex.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Dream Team
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
A coded message on the Net becomes an irresistible puzzle for Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram. Following the clues leads them to a meeting with Alexandra Davis, head of Software company Catalyst, and a job testing video games after school! The job of their dreams which brings unexpected surprises including the discovery of Virgil, a strange artificial intelligence loose on the Net.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: BabaKiueria
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Julian Pringle, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Geoffrey Atherden
results.brief_description:
‘BabaKiueria’ takes a satirical look at black-white relations in late twentieth century Australia, with a comic depiction of a racial role reversal. In documentary (or ‘mockumentary’) style, the film’s presenter investigates white lives in the fictitious land of ‘BabaKiueria’ (‘Barbeque Area’), where white people are a minority, living under black laws and suffering from discriminatory practices and attitudes held by the black majority. Written by Geoffrey Atherden (‘Mother and Son’, ‘Grass Roots’), the film was awarded a United Nations Media Peace Prize in 1987.
Stars Michelle Torres, Bob Maza, Kevin Smith, Cecily Polson, Tony Barry.

results.title: Beau'tiful
results.creator_credit: Sung Khuu, Photographic Imaging College and Dimaze Films
results.brief_description: A softly humming soundtrack lulls the viewer into a dreamlike state as this experimental student film uses a combination of camera techniques to takes us on an exquisite journey through metaphoric landscapes that explore the nature of human existence.

results.title: Catalyst: Fire Storm
results.creator_credit: Andrew Holland, Ian Cuming and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
A scientific investigation into the causes of the catastrophic Canberra bushfires of January 2003 where 474 homes were destroyed and four lives lost. Includes interviews with residents, scientists, environmentalists and fire-fighters.
Episode from the ABC TV series ‘Catalyst’ presented and narrated by Karina Kelly.

results.title: Quantum: A Green Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Gail Jarvis, Cathy Johnson and ABC-TV (Australia). Science Unit
results.brief_description:
In 1994 park rangers in the Wollemi National Park, New South Wales, discovered a grove of ancient trees thought to have been extinct for 60 million years. The location of the thirty-eight adult trees, identified as a genus of the family Araucariaceae, has been kept a secret from all but a handful of people to protect them from sightseers and those who would collect seeds to sell on the black market. Three years later Cathy Johnson is the first and only journalist to have been to the site of the Wollemi pines - but not without having been blindfolded during the helicopter journey in and out.
Broadcast on ABC-TV 10 July 1997 as part of the program ‘Quantum’ and produced with the assistance of NSW National Parks and Wildlife service.

results.title: A Big Country: The Legend of Jimmy Governor
results.brief_description:
Episode of ABC TV series ‘A Big Country’ exploring the real life story of Jimmy Governor, as compared to his fictional counterpart, Jimmie Blacksmith, in the novel and film, ‘The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith’. Includes interviews with author, Thomas Keneally, and film director, Fred Schepisi, on location during the making of the film.
Broadcast on ABC TV in April 1978. Reporter: Kenyon Castle. Narrator: Bob Plasto.

results.title: Four Corners: The Moonlight State
results.creator_credit: Shaun Hoyt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Despite denials by the Minister for Local Government Russ Hinze, Police Commissioner Terence Lewis, and Police Minister, Bill Gunn, widespread police corruption is evident throughout Queensland. Brothels masquerading as massage parlours with illegal gambling inhouse and drug trafficking are shown. Persons prominent in the criminal activities are named. This program was a major contributor to the setting up of the Fitzgerald Enquiry into Corruption in Queensland. Presenter: Andrew Olle. Reporter: Chris Masters.
Episode of the ABC TV program Four Corners, aired 11/5/1987.

results.title: Australian Story: Man For All Seasons: Wayne Bennett
results.creator_credit: Vanessa Gorman and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
This is Wayne Bennett’s story, a story of successes and failures, family, good times, challenging times, but most of all, about his passion for the Brisbane Broncos and helping them win more Grand Finals in his 20 years of coaching than any other club in Australian rugby league history. Introduced by Caroline Jones.
Broadcast on ABC TV on 6 May 1999. Reporters/producers include Ben Cheshire, Carolyn Davies, Brigid Donovan, Helen Grasswill, John Millard, Wendy Page.

results.title: Enough Rope: Can I Write the Ending?
results.creator_credit: Kerry Brewster, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Zapruder's Other Films
results.brief_description: What would you do if you thought you were about to die? This is an inspiring and moving story of three strong women, Annie Robinson, Nadeen Kovacic and Jasmyne Russell, each confronting life’s hardest journey, and how they’ve chosen to face their cancer and its ramifications. Presented by Andrew Denton, first broadcast on ABC Television on September 10, 2007.
